Name:		Gill Kernick
Current Role: 	Master Consultant – Sustainability, Safety & OpEx at JMJ
Location: 		London, UK
Summary:
Gill is not your classic out and out sales / BD professional. I would describe her as a “rainmaker” who by nature has seller-doer mentality but truly consultative in her approach. She is passionate about creating bespoke solutions for each customer that will offer long-term value for that organisation and enjoys working in a creative and innovative environment. She collaborates closely with other consulting teams in the business to ensure that she can offer the best possible solution for the customer.
Her current role is Master Consultant for JMJ in London. This was a newly created role for her which she started in 2020 and it has responsibility for designing and deli Name:		Gill Kernick
Current Role: 	Master Consultant – Sustainability, Safety & OpEx at JMJ
Location: 		London, UK
Summary:
Gill is not your classic out and out sales / BD professional. I would describe her as a “rainmaker” who by nature has seller-doer mentality but truly consultative in her approach. She is passionate about creating bespoke solutions for each customer that will offer long-term value for that organisation and enjoys working in a creative and innovative environment. She collaborates closely with other consulting teams in the business to ensure that she can offer the best possible solution for the customer.
Her current role is Master Consultant for JMJ in London. This was a newly created role for her which she started in 2020 and it has responsibility for designing and delivery bespoke solutions to key clients’ needs. Prior to this she was a Senior Consultant with a ‘cradle to grave’ approach – she works with key customers up to C-suite level and promoting best practice and continuous improvement across JMJ, especially with mentoring and coaching of more junior staff.
She has strong relationships with multinational corporate customers in various sectors, some of which include BHP Billiton, Shell, BP, Maersk Oil, Qatar Petroleum, Centrica, Novo Nordisk etc. and proven experience in the international environment – Europe, Asia Pacific, Africa, North America.
As discussed recently, Gill is not actively looking but she is intrigued by what DEKRA are trying to achieve. She has heard mixed messages about the company’s past reputation but change management is something she loves and she likes the idea of playing an influential role in instigating a step change in an organisation and helping to develop the long-term roadmap for DEKRA Organisational & Process Safety.
If she were to make a move, she would need to be convinced that the company has the right strategic vision when it comes to sustainability, transformation initiatives (such as digital innovations), agile working etc. and would need to feel comfortable that Senior Management would support change management practices.
With this in mind, she is open to having an introductory call with you to discuss DEKRA and the O&PS business in more depth, after which she should hopefully have more assurance on whether it’s the right company for her or not.
Current Package:
Do not have exact breakdown but base salary in the £110/115k mark plus bonus and benefits.
Candidate Name:	Gill Kernick
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location: 		London, UK
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor of Business Administration (Honours) Cum Laude – University of Natal, Durban (1993)
Subjects included Training and Development, Corporate Strategy & Human Resource Management.
Bachelor of Commerce, Upper Second equivalent – University of Witwatersrand, Johannesburg (1992)
Professional:
Academy of Executive Coaching, Systemic Team Coaching (2017)
Certified practitioner in Operating States (methodology to bring projects sustainably into existence) (2015)
School of Coaching, Public Coaching Programme, Senior Practitioner (2013)
Member of EMCC (2013)
CAREER SUMMARY
2011 to date JMJ Associates, London
2020 to date
Position: Master Consultant – Sustainability, Safety & Operational Excellence
Bringing innovative approaches to designing and delivering bespoke solutions to client’s needs. This has included experimenting with innovative measurement techniques e.g., big data and narrative analysis.
Leading a working group to design JMJ’s sustainability practice.
Upgrading our IIF suite with the latest thinking in HOP, Safety II, and complexity.
Working across regions to advise other consulting teams on innovative solutions and the latest thinking in safety.
Clients include: Spirit Energy, PM Group, Metro (Denmark), A Big Data Company
2011 – 2019
Position: Senior Consultant – Safety, Culture, Leadership
Designing and delivering client engagements (from cradle to grave).
Internal roles have included coaching leadership teams and developing consultants.
External Key Projects included:
Centrica - Organisational Change through Safety – Complex, emergent engagement beginning with top 50 Senior Executives. Currently working with largest

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
